posts.title: Explore Free Access E-Books for Every Field of Interestüìö
posts.excerpt: Discover treasure troves of free open-access e-books across various subjects through platforms like DOAB, Project Gutenberg, Free Computer Books, and more - perfect for students, researchers, and lifelong learners.
posts.content:
In today's digital age, the availability of free e-books has transformed the way we learn and explore new topics. Whether you're a student, a researcher, or someone with a passion for lifelong learning, there's a treasure trove of open-access e-books available for free. These resources span a wide range of subjects and are accessible to anyone with an internet connection. Let's take a closer look at some of the platforms that make this possible:

Directory of Open Access Books (DOAB)

The DOAB offers a curated collection of scholarly, peer-reviewed books covering a variety of academic disciplines. From history and philosophy to science and technology, there's something for everyone here.

Visit: https://www.doabooks.org/

E-Books Directory

This platform provides a comprehensive catalog of open-access e-books, documents, and lecture notes. It's perfect for students and professionals alike who are seeking reliable learning resources.

Visit: https://www.e-booksdirectory.com/

Free Computer Books

Dive into the world of information technology, computer science, mathematics, and more. Free Computer Books is a haven for tech enthusiasts and students alike, offering tutorials, lecture notes, and e-books on various IT-related topics.

Visit: https://freecomputerbooks.com/

Free Tech Books

This directory focuses on resources in computer science, engineering, and programming. It's an excellent starting point for those looking to sharpen their technical skills or explore programming languages.

Visit: https://www.freetechbooks.com/

Library of Economics and Liberty (Econlib)

Dedicated to advancing the study of economics and liberty, Econlib offers a unique collection of resources for students, educators, and researchers in economic thought.

Visit: https://www.econlib.org/

Project Gutenberg

As the pioneer of digital literature, Project Gutenberg hosts over 60,000 free e-books, including classics, historical works, and literature in the public domain. It's the go-to place for timeless reads.

Visit: https://www.gutenberg.org/

Why Access Open E-Books?

  • Cost-Effective Learning: These resources are free, making education and research accessible to everyone.
  • Convenience: Access e-books anytime, anywhere, without the need for physical storage.
  • Wide Variety: From academic research to leisure reading, there's something for every interest.

Start exploring these platforms today and unlock the knowledge that's just a click away. With free e-books, the only limit is your curiosity!

#FreeEBooks #OpenAccess #LifelongLearning

posts.title: Advancing Library Services with KOHA ILS Training
posts.excerpt: Library staff complete intensive KOHA Integrated Library System training at National Library of the Philippines, learning advanced tools to enhance services and streamline operations.
posts.content:
The Aldersgate College Library & Learning Resource Center staff recently completed an intensive KOHA Integrated Library System (ILS) training, held from October 16‚Äì18, 2024, at the National Library of the Philippines. This hands-on workshop introduced advanced tools and methods to enhance library services and streamline operations.

Setting the Foundation

The training kicked off with the installation of the Ubuntu operating system and the KOHA ILS using bash script commands. The session emphasized understanding the system's infrastructure and resolving technical errors, empowering the team to customize the platform to suit the library's unique requirements.

Diving into Cataloging and Patron Management

Participants explored the cataloging module, gaining practical experience in creating and editing bibliographic records. The trainer also demonstrated KOHA's robust search and reporting tools. Further, staff learned to manage patron information, user permissions, and even implemented an in-out management system for monitoring library attendance.

Mastering Circulation and Data Management

The final day focused on the circulation module, which covered processes like book loans, returns, and managing fines. Importantly, the team learned how to integrate KOHA across a Local Area Network (LAN) and perform critical database backups to secure library data.

The training marked a significant step in modernizing the library's operations. By leveraging KOHA ILS, the Aldersgate College Professional Library aims to deliver more efficient and effective services, ensuring patrons have seamless access to information resources and an enriched library experience.

Stay tuned as we implement these advancements to better serve our community!

#LibraryInnovation #KOHAILS #AldersgateCollegeLibrary&LearningResourceCenter

posts.title: üì¢New Library Service: Library Research Clinicüì¢
posts.excerpt: Introducing Library Research Clinic to support students in research proposal development and paper writing with expert guidance and research skill enhancement.
posts.content:
Title: Library Research Clinic: Enhancing Student Research Skills

Introduction

The Library Research Clinic is an initiative designed to support students in crafting their research proposals and writing research papers. This service aims to equip students with essential research skills, enhance their academic writing abilities, and provide them with access to expert guidance throughout the research process. The Library Research Clinic is a vital initiative that empowers students with the necessary research skills to excel in their academic pursuits. By fostering a research-supportive environment, this program will contribute to the overall academic success and scholarly engagement of students.

Objectives
  1. To provide structured guidance on research proposal development.
  2. To improve students' academic writing and citation skills.
  3. To offer one-on-one mentorship and group workshops on research methodologies.
  4. To familiarize students with library resources, including databases, citation tools, and research management software.
  5. To create a collaborative learning environment for peer review and feedback.
